part2.question:
Describe your favorite place in your house where you can relax. You should say:
Where it is
What it is like
What you enjoy doing there
And explain why you feel relaxed at this place.
part2.model_answer: I'd like to describe my bedroom, which is undoubtedly my favorite place to relax after a long, stressful day. It is located on the second floor of my parents' house, overlooking the peaceful backyard garden. The room is incredibly Spacious [宽敞的] and painted in a soft, calming blue, which makes it feel warm and Cozy [舒适的]. What I enjoy doing there most is simply lying on my comfortable bed and reading a good book or listening to soothing music. It offers me much-needed Peace and quiet [宁静] away from the noise of the household. I feel relaxed because it is my private sanctuary where I can truly be myself, reflect on my thoughts, and Make myself at home without any disturbances.

part2.question:
Describe a house or apartment you would like to live in. You should say:
Where it would be located
How big it would be
How you would decorate it
And explain why this is your dream home.
part2.model_answer: I would absolutely love to live in a Modern [现代的] apartment in the vibrant city center. It would be located near a large park so I could have a nice view but still be close to shops and cafes. I imagine it being quite large, with floor-to-ceiling windows to let in plenty of natural light. I would decorate it in a minimalist style, keeping it clean and definitely not Messy [凌乱的]. I would create a Supportive [支持的] environment for my work and hobbies. This is my dream home because it offers both urban [城市的] convenience and a comfortable, stylish living space where I can entertain friends and enjoy life.

part2.question:
Describe a home you visited that you liked. You should say:
Whose home it was
Where it was located
What the decoration was like
And explain what made it impressive.
part2.model_answer: I once visited my uncle's new house in the countryside, which I found very impressive. It was a beautiful, traditional cottage surrounded by tall trees and flowers. The decoration inside was very rustic, with lots of wooden furniture and warm colors, making it feel very Intimate [私密的] and welcoming. Everything was carefully Decorated [装饰过的] with local art. I was impressed because it felt so different from my city apartment; it had a sense of history and charm that many modern [现代的] buildings lack. It was the perfect example of a Home sweet home [温馨的家] where anyone would feel happy to live.

part3.question: Why is it difficult for some people to relax?
part3.model_answer: [Opinion] In our modern [现代的] Urban [城市的] lives, it is very hard to switch off completely. [Reason] We are constantly surrounded by Superficial [表面的] distractions like social media and work emails that demand our attention. [Example] Even when we try to rest, our minds are still active processing information from the day. [Extension] This lack of downtime affects our ability to truly relax and find peace.

part3.question: Which is more important, mental relaxation or physical relaxation?
part3.model_answer: [Opinion] I believe mental relaxation is a Lifelong [终身的] necessity for happiness. [Reason] Physical tiredness can usually be cured by a good night's sleep, but mental stress accumulates over time. [Example] A person can be physically fit but suffer from burnout if they don't care for their mind. [Extension] Therefore, mental well-being should be prioritized above all else.

part3.question: Why do people prefer to live in new houses?
part3.model_answer: [Opinion] New houses are often seen as a better Investment [投资] for the future. [Reason] They usually come with warranties and require less maintenance than older properties, which saves money. [Example] Also, their energy efficiency improves Affordability [可负担性] in terms of monthly utility bills. [Extension] This makes them incredibly attractive to first-time buyers looking for excellent value.

part3.question: How has the "Work From Home" trend changed the way people design their houses?
part3.model_answer: [Opinion] The WFH trend has shifted design priorities towards functionality and workspace. [Reason] People now need dedicated offices within their homes to separate work from leisure. [Example] Architects are including home offices even in small apartments to meet this demand. [Extension] However, Regulation [法规] on building standards may need to update to reflect these new needs.

part3.question: What are the social consequences of housing shortages in major cities?
part3.model_answer: [Opinion] The Shortage [短缺] of housing causes prices to Go through the roof [价格飞涨] rapidly. [Reason] This makes it incredibly difficult for young people to Get on the property ladder [买第一套房] and build wealth. [Example] Many are forced to rent for years instead of buying their own home. [Extension] Everyone deserves A roof over one's head [栖身之所], so this is a serious social issue.

part3.question: Should the government regulate housing prices to ensure everyone has a place to live?
part3.model_answer: [Opinion] Yes, Regulation [法规] is necessary to control the market and ensure fairness. [Reason] Without it, developers might focus only on luxury homes, ignoring the need for affordable housing. [Example] Government policies can ensure a balance between profit and social responsibility. [Extension] This helps maintain a fair society where housing is accessible to all citizens.
